bibl.title: A Catalogue within a Catalogue: Helen's Suitors in the Hesiodic Catalogue of Women (frr. 196-204).
bibl.note: Introduction. - The wooing of Helen. - The catalogue of suitors and the motif of the wedding contest. - Helen's suitors. - Castor and Polydeuces. - The role of Agamemnon. - The sons of Amphiaraus. - Boastful Ajax misinterpreted.

bibl.title: The Hesiodic Catalogue of Women. Constructions and Reconstructions

bibl.seg: CINGANO Ettore, A Catalogue within a Catalogue: Helen's Suitors in the Hesiodic Catalogue of Women (frr. 196-204).
Richard HUNTER (Ed.), The Hesiodic Catalogue of Women. Constructions and Reconstructions (Cambridge, 2005) pp. 118-152.

Introduction. - The wooing of Helen. - The catalogue of suitors and the motif of the wedding contest. - Helen's suitors. - Castor and Polydeuces. - The role of Agamemnon. - The sons of Amphiaraus. - Boastful Ajax misinterpreted.
